text:
Protests spread over police shootings.

Police promised reforms.

Every year, they still shoot and kill nearly 1,000 people. https://t.co/xLoWOrijsP

name: washingtonpost
text:
The year over year consistency has confounded those who have spent decades studying the issue.

https://t.co/1GOTCRAxsx https://t.co/VtuPgf5XHh

name: washingtonpost
text:
The number killed has remained steady despite fluctuating crime rates, changeovers in big-city police leadership and a nationwide push for criminal justice reform.

Even amid the coronavirus pandemic, police shot and killed 463 people through June 7. https://t.co/1GOTCRAxsx
